title: [K-12] Mobile Microlearning Course for Expanding Work-Integrated Learning (WIL)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Understanding of Career Exploration and Social Advancement
context.additional_context: Students learn WIL theory and practical case applications in mobile environments, conducting small-scale projects linked to community partnerships

learning_goals: Learners can explain the core concepts and educational effects of WIL

Learners design 1 WIL-based problem-solving project (defining problem + proposing 3 solutions) using Padlet or Google Classroom, establish a 3-phase implementation plan (research-execution-evaluation), complete it within 5 days, and submit it to a digital portfolio (PDF/Google Slides). Teachers must award ≥'B+' in ≥2 of 3 rubric items: problem definition clarity, solution feasibility, implementation plan specificity

Learners select 1 community partner (e.g., welfare center, library, fire station), analyze 3 WIL (Work-Integrated Learning) scenarios, simulate real workplace situations through role-play, and receive peer evaluations
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
